header.title: Undoing Yourself with Energized Meditation and Other Devices

central_thesis: The central thesis of "Undoing Yourself" is that conventional human consciousness is a 'robot-like state' conditioned by societal dogmas, inherited beliefs, and unexamined psychological programming. True liberation, joy, and freedom are attained by consciously 'undoing' this conditioned self through rigorous self-experimentation, 'Energized Meditation,' and various 'devices' (magickal techniques). This process, termed 'Brain Change Willed,' aims to dismantle the 'savage superego' and societal 'dogma' to allow the individual's 'True Will' to emerge, leading to a 'polytheistic' awareness of the multiple 'Gods' (brain functions/personalities) within and without, thereby enabling intentional self-reprogramming and co-creation of reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: New Introduction/Preface by Robert Anton Wilson
structure_content.summary: Wilson critiques the 'free will' delusion, asserting that humans are largely robotic. He introduces 'Un-doing and re-robotizing oneself' as a neurological technique, akin to 'Hard Play,' to be performed 'every day.' He highlights the book's challenge to the 'Primate Ego' and the 'Aristotelian mind-set,' advocating for becoming 'less the computer and more the programmer' of one's own reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: Original Introduction by Dr. Israel Regardie
structure_content.summary: Regardie praises Hyatt's system as a dynamic and potent meditative method, distilling elements from psychotherapy, Reichian therapy, and Zen. He notes its efficacy for those genuinely committed to change and considers it superior to many other systems he encountered in his occult and psychological practice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Is There Anything New Under The Sun? by Christopher S. Hyatt, Ph.D. and Baron Peter Von Gundlach
structure_content.summary: This section argues against the 'maladaptive fallacy' that human nature is inherently flawed, presenting 'original sin' as a denial of our true experimental nature. It posits biology as absolute and culture as relative, offering practical societal 'solutions' like 'Shalhome' housing and 'Random representation' in politics, to counteract cultural distortions and reclaim our biological destiny.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter One — Getting Out Of Bed
structure_content.summary: This chapter introduces the core premise: achieving 'total JOY and FREEDOM' requires 'undoing all non-joyous experiences' through hard work in 'The LAB,' where the reader acts as 'Scientist, Subject, and Experimenter.' It emphasizes shedding preconceived notions and embracing a Gurdjieffian view of humans as potential robots, capable of developing 'Soul' and 'Free Will' by completing a 'tension—charge—discharge and relaxation' cycle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Two — A Zen Statement
structure_content.summary: Focusing on enlightenment, this chapter asserts that it necessitates 'giving up' the most precious aspects of the conditioned self. It posits 'SOMETHING IS ALWAYS AT STAKE: YOU,' and introduces the 'STOP' technique for interrupting habitual 'DEAD TONE' phrases to 'WAKE UP' and realize that 'EVERY MAN AND EVERY WOMAN IS A STAR'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Three — The Experimenter
structure_content.summary: This chapter instructs the reader to be a clear-eyed 'Experimenter' in their own 'LAB,' devoid of 'wish to be's,' and not to 'lust after results.' It details life cycles (inspiration, frustration, effort, satisfaction) and highlights 'FEAR' as a sign of unexamined 'survival tension.' It encourages recognizing the 'LAB' as the site for 'UnDoing' past experiences, aiming to become a 'COSMIC SCIENTIST' and 'COSMIC COMIC' by moving between chaos and form, rooted in 'Orphic Mysteries'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Three & One Half — Insanity Is Meditation?
structure_content.summary: This section posits that true 'Enlightenment' involves 'clearing the mind of its noise' and ultimately 'losing the mind altogether,' which some may perceive as 'insanity.' It defines enlightenment as the 'Real Knowledge' that one is a programmable robot, capable of 're-programming' the brain according to one's 'True Will,' thereby transcending unconscious programming.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Four — Dogma Junkies
structure_content.summary: This chapter analyzes 'dogma' as a societal 'drug,' where individuals become 'dogma addicts' believing in 'absolute truth.' It explores how 'dogma' is maintained and exploited by 'Pushers and Dealers' through 'Survival—Attacks' and 'Dogma Illness,' ultimately controlling individuals and justifying power structures.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Four & One Half — Method II
structure_content.summary: This method provides specific physical exercises (deep breaths, collapsing body from waist, leg stretches with exhalation, pelvic tilts, jaw movements) designed to release deep-seated tensions and increase awareness of the body's energy. The goal is to facilitate sensing the 'pelvic region' and 'life force movement,' recommending recording experiences in a journal.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Five — New Organs For All
structure_content.summary: This chapter critiques Western thought, particularly Aristotelian logic and 'Cave Mentality,' which limit perception and perpetuate dogma. It advocates for 'CHANGE YOUR GLASSES' to perceive reality anew and 'UNDO yourself NOW.' It introduces the concept of 'Brain Change Willed' as 'Magick,' emphasizing that our perceptions and reality are fluid and programmable.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Six — Method III
structure_content.summary: Building on previous methods, this section introduces advanced physical exercises like 'STAND UP' (bending knees, flopping body, facial distortions, head turns, gag reflex stimulation) to further reduce deep body tension. It also includes 'GETTING OUT OF YOUR HEAD' exercises involving verbalizing worries, expressing joy, alternating laughter and tears, and tensing/relaxing the body, culminating in meditation for mind reprogramming.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Six & One Half — Results
structure_content.summary: This concluding section reiterates the benefits of establishing one's 'LAB' and the importance of continued study in Tantra Yoga, Hypnosis, and Magic, explicitly naming Aleister Crowley (Master Therion) and Israel Regardie as key sources. It defines the ultimate goal as 'Brain Change Willed' or Magick, emphasizing that serious engagement with the work leads to self-transformation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Third Section / The Polytheism of Sisters/Brothers
structure_content.summary: This section challenges monotheism, arguing that 'God Is Dead' signals the demise of the singular self-illusion and the birth of 'Gods' representing multiple brain functions and personalities. It introduces 'FUTANT MUTANTS' who embrace 'Know Thy Selfs Is The Great Truths' over 'Know Thy Self Is The Great Lie,' advocating for a 'Poly-theistic Brain' model to foster individuality and overcome collective stupidity.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Seven — Who Is Dr. Hyatt? Now!
structure_content.summary: Hyatt asserts his authority stems from 'desire, whim, quirks of fate' and 'legitimate agencies,' emphasizing the fluidity of legitimacy. He shares personal anecdotes of questioning reality and purpose, revealing a journey of discovering that his life was not his 'intention,' but rather a 'nuts' divine plan, leading to the insight: 'If you look into the eye of the Buddha be prepared to find everything, and at ONCE nothing'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Eight — The Magickal Life
structure_content.summary: This chapter proclaims 'THE GODDESS OF THE NEW AEON HAS A NAME AND IT'S DOIT,' asserting 'Magick Is US' and the 'GROUND OF LIFE.' It defines Magick as 'DESIRE' and 'CHAOS,' which, when channeled by 'WILL,' develops 'Power.' The section highlights that 'Magick Is At The Base, THE REST IS THE STATUE,' emphasizing that true life is magickal and born from chaotic desire.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Nine — The Order of the White Lion
structure_content.summary: This chapter introduces the mythical 'Order of the White Lion' (OWL) as a future Tantric order, aiming to transcend sex differences and patriarchal monotheism by re-empowering the 'feminine goddess.' It proposes training women as 'Scientists, Inventors, Artists' to lead a 'New Aeon' of 'brother/sister polytheism.' A key teaching is 'WE ARE ALL ALIENS,' with transcendence defined as 'POWER Concentration' without moral judgment, urging readers to act like Gods/Goddesses.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Ten — Western Sexual Magick And The Creation Of The Magickal Child
structure_content.summary: Co-developed by Regardie and Hyatt, this chapter details powerful sexual magick methods designed to 'intensify AND control energy' and direct it via 'True Will.' It outlines preliminary exercises over six months, including deep breathing, chakra focus (Muladhara, Svadhisthana, Manipuraka, Anahata, Visuddha, Ajna, Sahasrara), and genital stimulation, aimed at opening chakras and increasing 'psycho/spiritual powers.' Rituals from the Golden Dawn (Banishing Ritual, Middle Pillar) are integrated.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Eleven — The God-Test And The Meditations
structure_content.summary: This chapter proposes 'forced depression' as a meditation to achieve tranquility amidst 'hideous' images, a method for 'controlled suffering' leading to cheerfulness. It introduces a 'God-Test' to rate perceptions of various deities (Christian, African, Dionysus) and then encourages creating one's 'own God' to map personal and cultural belief systems. The 'new law' is 'STAY SIMPLE—STAY LEANi,' emphasizing ignoring minor details to grasp major truths.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Twelve — On The Invokation Of Eris: Chaos As Prerequisite To Change
structure_content.summary: This chapter explores Eris (Discordia) as a 'midwife of Chaos' and 'creative destruction,' essential for change. It advocates 'BREAK THE SHELL AND YOU'LL FIND MAGICK' by disrupting 'normal' reality through 'VACATIONING IN ALTERNITY' via ritual, sex, drugs, and sensory deprivation. It stresses that 'Magick is an evolutionary Science' involving 'intentional evolution' and breaking habits to become a 'meta-programmer' of one's reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Thirteen — Who Owns The Planet Earth?
structure_content.summary: This chapter examines different models of 'OWNERSHIP' (God, Society, Cyber-Shaman), asserting that true freedom comes when 'Man OWNS Hirself.' It critiques the 'Limited Supply Dogma' for its role in societal control and argues that 'unlimited supply and immortality' are iconoclastic to existing power structures, leading to a 'REPOSSESSING the SELF'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Fourteen — The Kingdom of the Beast
structure_content.summary: Presented as a graphic novel, this chapter vividly illustrates the concepts of 'Brain Change Willed' and Magick through a narrative journey. It depicts encounters with mystical figures and explores themes of transformation, challenging conventional perceptions of reality and reinforcing the operative nature of the book's teachings.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Fifteen — OH, HOW I HATE YOU! MEIN KRIEG
structure_content.summary: This chapter reiterates the harsh realities of life, asserting 'Life is unfair to the losers—just for the winners.' It revisits the 'STOP' technique to break habitual thoughts and expands on 'Dogma' as a pervasive societal addiction, highlighting the role of 'Dogma Junkies' in maintaining control. The 'LAB' is presented as the arena for ongoing self-transformation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Sixteen — AND OTHER DEVICES by Jack Willis, MFT, D.C.
structure_content.summary: Willis contributes practical exercises to 'undo' the 'savage superego' and liberate personality rigidity. Techniques include eating disliked foods, purposefully breaking social patterns, initiating conversations with strangers, altering church attendance, and modifying sexual behavior. The section differentiates 'necessary' from 'happenstantial' aspects of life and provides exercises for identifying and expressing emotions/tensions ('EXERCISE 13') and systematically challenging one's own traits ('EXERCISE 14').

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Seventeen — THE ALCHEMICAL TEACHINGS OF FRATER ALBERTUS & THE PARACELSUS RESEARCH SOCIETY by Joseph C. Lisiewski, Ph.D.
structure_content.summary: Lisiewski details the practical laboratory alchemy teachings of Frater Albertus, focusing on the 'Three Alchemical Essentials' (Salt, Sulfur, Mercury) and 'Three Alchemical Processes' (Separation, Purification, Cohabation). It describes the creation of the 'Herbal Stone' and 'Homunculus,' emphasizing the scientific and practical approach to transformation and the importance of inner spiritual development for outer alchemical success.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Eighteen — EROS ET THANATOS by Virgil Mae Bathin
structure_content.summary: This controversial chapter explores the union of 'Eros and Thanatos' (love and death) in sexual practices, particularly erotic asphyxia, as a means of psychological integration and self-liberation. It challenges moralistic judgments, presenting such experiences as intense pathways to understanding and embracing 'deviant sexual desires' and paradoxes within the psyche, thereby facilitating a deeper form of Tantric growth.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Nineteen — A Few Words from the Prime Minister by Zehm Aloim
structure_content.summary: This allegorical narrative describes a journey to meet a disheveled 'God' and his 'beautiful Daughter,' symbolizing a changing divine image and the need for new approaches beyond traditional solutions. The journey highlights the process of self-discovery and transformation, urging readers to embrace a non-traditional path to enlightenment and personal power.

key_concepts.definition: A sensory-tonic (muscular) technique developed by Hyatt, combining Eastern and Western information, designed to destroy tension and thought, achieve mindlessness, and facilitate 'Brain Change Willed' by converting tension into thought and sensation into meaning. It aims to shake up the individual and transform them into a 'STAR'.

The core process of self-transformation, involving the systematic dismantling of conditioned responses, beliefs, and societal programming. It's about 'getting rid of what you now call yourself' to allow the 'True Will' to emerge, leading to freedom and joy.

A metaphorical and practical space where the individual is the 'Scientist, Subject, and Experimenter.' It signifies a commitment to rigorous self-experimentation, observation, and transformation, free from external judgment and dogmatic constraints.

Crowley's concept, reinterpreted by Hyatt, refers to the individual's unique purpose and path, unburdened by conditioned ego or societal expectations. Achieving it involves 're-programming your own brain' and aligning actions with an awakened, non-robotic consciousness.

The intentional and conscious reprogramming of one's own brain and chemistry to achieve desired outcomes. Magick is presented not as mumbo jumbo but as an 'evolutionary Science' and 'the Science and Art of causing Change to occur in conformity with the Will.' It's about becoming the 'programmer of the computer' rather than the 'computer' itself.

'Dogma' is conceptualized as a drug, where belief in 'absolute truth' leads to addiction. 'Dogma Junkies' are individuals controlled by these fixed beliefs, perpetuated by 'Pushers and Dealers' (societal institutions/authorities) through 'Survival—Attacks' and 'Dogma Illness,' which are social mechanisms to maintain status quo and prevent individual liberation.

A philosophical stance contrasting monotheism, suggesting that the notion of a single 'Self' or 'God' is an illusion. Instead, humanity consists of 'many brains and personalities' or 'Neuro-Gods,' advocating for the integration and exploration of these multiple aspects rather than forceful unification, leading to 'the freedom from restrictions, the new Nirvana(s).'

Eris (Discordia) is personified as the 'midwife of Chaos' and 'creative destruction,' a necessary force for change and evolution. Invoking Eris involves deliberately disrupting 'normal' reality, breaking habits, and challenging conditioned behaviors to access 'magickal power' and create new realities, as 'Chaos' is the origin of life.

A distinction introduced to analyze behaviors and beliefs. 'Necessary' refers to what is truly required for a civilized society (e.g., 'don't steal'), while 'happenstantial' refers to arbitrary customs, preferences, or internal laws (superego impositions) that are not essential and can be 'undone' for personal liberation.

Describes all living things and the world as operating in a cycle of 'tension—charge—discharge and relaxation.' Completing this cycle is essential for experiencing 'joy or happiness,' while an inability to complete it leads to failure and lack of fulfillment.

The internal 'policeman' or 'inner cop' that demands adherence to rules, loads individuals with guilt, shame, and rigidity. 'Undoing Yourself' involves 'slaying the savage superego' to liberate the personality and body from its tyrannical control and allow for genuine choice and pleasure.

Alchemical concepts discussed in the context of Frater Albertus's teachings. The 'Herbal Stone' is a perfected essence of an herb, produced through separation, purification, and cohabation, mimicking the Philosopher's Stone. The 'Homunculus' is a miniature human being, a 'Magickal Child,' created by a male alchemist impregnating 'Mother Earth' (Gur) with his seed, signifying the generation of spiritual or physical entities through alchemical processes.

The integration of the life instinct (Eros) and the death instinct (Thanatos), particularly explored in the context of sexual practices like erotic asphyxia. This union, often seen as 'deviant,' is presented as a path to psychological integration and self-liberation, challenging conventional morality and fostering a deeper understanding of one's own desires.

practical_system.description: The system presented in 'Undoing Yourself' is a multi-faceted approach to radical self-transformation, termed 'Energized Meditation' and 'Brain Change Willed.' It combines physical, mental, and sexual techniques derived from Tantra, Chaos Magic, Reichian therapy, and Gurdjieffian work. The core principle is 'undoing' the conditioned self (the 'robot') by disrupting habitual patterns and confronting deep-seated psychological 'dogmas' and tensions. This is achieved through intense, often uncomfortable, exercises designed to release bio-spiritual energy, enhance consciousness, and ultimately enable the individual to 're-program' their own brain according to their 'True Will.' The process emphasizes continuous experimentation, self-observation, and a willingness to embrace chaos as a prerequisite for change, with the ultimate goal of becoming a 'Cosmic Comic' and a 'Star' in control of one's own reality.
tools: Journal or diary (for recording experiences, thoughts, dreams, divinations)
Tarot cards (Strength Card for Lioness/Goddess imagery, Tower Card for Eris)
Tree of Life symbolism (for understanding chakra and energetic models)
Incense, candles, soft music (for ambiance in Tantric practices)
Scientific models (psycho-social-biology, neuro-biology, quantum physics) as conceptual frameworks
Computer (mentioned as a 'magickal tool' and for writing/programming)
rituals: Energized Meditation Methods I, II, III: A series of physical and vocal exercises including intense breathing (e.g., three-count inhale/exhale saying 'AH'), facial distortions, humming, chattering, shoulder pulls, leg stretches, head turns, and full-body tensing/relaxation cycles, often accompanied by screaming or shouting. These are designed to release deep muscle tension, destroy thought patterns, and mobilize bio-emotional energy.

The God-Test Meditations: Guided meditations involving concentration on chakras (heart, Ajna), vivid imaging of 'hideous things' (e.g., self-decomposition, torture of enemies) to achieve tranquility amidst discomfort. Also, rating different 'Gods' (Christian, African, Dionysus) and one's 'own God' on scales of 'Strong-Weak,' 'Orderly-Chaotic,' and 'Lustful-Chaste' to map personal belief systems.

Superego-Liberation Exercises (Jack Willis): Practical, disruptive actions to challenge social conditioning and internal 'laws,' including eating disliked foods, purposefully breaking social patterns, initiating conversations with strangers, changing church attendance, and deliberately altering typical sexual behavior (e.g., erotic asphyxia as a 'Left Hand Path' for integrating Eros and Thanatos).

Western Sexual Magick: Tantric practices involving deep breathing, pelvic tilts, genital stimulation, and ultimately intercourse, with specific focus on channeling energy to various chakras (Muladhara, Svadhisthana, Manipuraka, Anahata, Visuddha, Ajna, Sahasrara). These practices are highly structured and require preparatory periods without genital contact, designed to intensify and control sexual energy for 'psycho/spiritual powers' and creating 'Magickal Children' or God-forms.

The STOP Technique: A mindfulness practice to interrupt habitual 'DEAD TONE' phrases and patterned responses by mentally or verbally saying 'STOP,' being silent, and then silently affirming one's true knowledge of self ('SAY IT SILENTLY, WAKE UP').

Invokation of Eris: Rituals to embrace chaos and creative destruction, involving 'frenzied Erisian dance,' standing on one's head, extended sexual practice/tantra, inducing extreme emotional states, Kriya Yoga techniques, and practicing 'gibberish' or Socratic dialectic to disrupt 'normal' reality and access 'alternity'.

relevant_quotes.text: The one sure way to make yourself unpopular in the United States these days is to mention the fact that Christianity and Democracy have been among the worst disasters to ever befall the human race. Nonetheless, as all students of history know, Christianity has been the bloodiest and most destructive religion in the long career of fanaticism on this planet; although Liberals and Rationalists keep reminding us of that tragic record of the Religion of Love, few of them have cared to observe or remember the data on warfare collected by Harvard sociologist, Prof. Pitrim Sorokin.

The 'free will' delusion is much more serious than any of that. It is the kind of radical 180-degree reversal of reality that, once it enters a person's mind, guarantees that they will be incapable of understanding anything happening around them; they might as well be deaf, dumb, blind and wearing signs warning the world, 'ULTIMATE DESTINA TION: THE MADHOUSE.'

The reason many readers of Crowley do not understand True Will is that these earnest students have never performed any of the exercizes that Crowley provides for those who sincerely want to de-robotize themselves and experience what is meant by True Will.
DO IT EVERY DAY

Dr. Hyatt is a rude, insulting and deliberately annoying writer. He does not soothe or pacify the reader with the Christian and Democratic mythology of our society by pretending that we are all free and rational people here. He insists on reminding us, every few pages, in the most blunt language possible, that most of us most of the time are conditioned chimpanzees in a cage.

The ego and its delusions must be undermined—either attacked openly and bluntly, as in the Gurdjieff system and this book, or subverted more subtly and slowly, as in certain other systems— before any real progress can be made toward 'liberation,' 'enlighten ment,' 'finding IT,' discovering the 'True Will' in Crowley's sense, or whatever is your favorite term for becoming less robotic and more aware—less the computer and more the programmer of the computer— less the conditioned rat in the Behaviorist's maze and more the Beyond-Human that the Sufic-Hermetic traditions and Neitzsche have predicted.
To achieve Enlightenment (The Real Knowledge That You Are A Robot And Have Been Programmed, And That You Can Re-Program Your Brain According To Your True Will.) you must first put yourself aside.

The maladaptive fallacy is based on the assumption that man's nature is inherently flawed. What does this mean? Miss Man aged Man has decided through aeons of self-reflection that what the observer observes (man) is in fact — 'No-Dam-Good.'
Magick Is US 'Saith the Lord'
MAGICK is DESIRE
To PERFORM MAGICK MEANS TO GATHER GREAT AMOUNTS OF PSYCHO-EMOTIVE BIO-CHEMICAL ENERGY TO A POINT AND DIRECT IT AT WILL

Eris assists evolution, and as she draws her lifeforce from the eternal progression of contraries—worrying not about moral goods and evils—she works day and night to cure stasis of its stiffness. Yet while the hard-headed conservative might wage war against the idea that change is the only constant, the modern brain change technician works to plug into the Prima Potentia of Chaos, playing and flirting with HIr maid-of-honor Eris, taking sweetsour pleasure in the perpetual creation and destruction of perceived reality, death and rebirth.
Without Magick there is no Life. With nothing but Magick there is no advancement in what man living.
The purpose of these sexual practices is to intensify AND control energy and then move that energy according to your true will.
I orgasmed violently!!!!!!!!!!
Eros and Thanatos are not opposites! They are one and the same!
The true ideal of democracy is not practiced anywhere in the world today. As it is practiced, it is divorced from its roots, the intelligence and spirit of the people.

The truth is we are constantly being programmed by parents, friends, ads, authors, radios, movies, t.v., teachers and politicians. Finally these programs become so much a part of us, that we begin to question our every thought and action in terms of these programs.

Now the time has come when everyone on the planet must take the responsibility for Self-Re-Programming. Matter is perfecting itself and we will find that it is centered in our consciousness. Therefore, to be prepared for the coming Universal Expansion our machined selves must be outfitted with new neural patterns.

The only way out is in. If you want out of your theories and your jails, start by being a COSMIC SCIENTIST. When you do that long enough you will become a COSMIC COMIC. The theory of open end-ed-ness requires that you first become UN-DONE;

critical_analysis.relevance: "Undoing Yourself" is highly relevant within Western Esotericism and Occultism as it directly addresses and operationalizes concepts from Chaos Magic, Thelema (Crowley), and psychological models (Reich, Gurdjieff, Leary, Jung) to achieve practical self-transformation. It distinguishes itself by its provocative, anti-dogmatic, and aggressively empirical approach, emphasizing direct experience and experimentation over inherited beliefs. The book's unique blend of physical, mental, and sexual practices offers a 'Brain Change Willed' system aimed at personal and even species-level evolution, explicitly challenging both traditional religious and conventional psychological frameworks. It positions itself as a 'science of self-change,' breaking from typical esoteric literature by demanding tangible results and confronting the reader's conditioned limitations head-on.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for 'Undoing Yourself' consists of individuals who are deeply dissatisfied with conventional life, society, and traditional self-improvement or spiritual paths. They must be willing to engage in 'hard work' and 'hard play,' embrace discomfort, and challenge their most cherished beliefs and 'sacred' personality traits. This is not a book for the 'morally timid or psychologically weak,' but for those ready for radical, sometimes shocking, self-experimentation to achieve profound personal liberation and 'Brain Change Willed.' It appeals to practitioners and students of occultism, especially Chaos Magicians, who value direct experience, anti-authoritarianism, and a scientific yet mystical approach to consciousness and reality.
